Events that occurred on 19 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1932 - Artist Fritz Möser is born.
1954 - Actor Ken Stott is born.
1971 - J.R.R. Tolkien receives a letter from William Cater (see Letter 330).
1976 - The Father Christmas Letters is published in the US.
2005 - The Lord of the Rings Sketchbook is published.
2010 - The Dragon's Apprentice is published.
2011 - Brother Joseph Power dies.
2016 - The posthumous publication, Beren and Lúthien, edited by Christopher Tolkien, is announced for publication on 4 May 2017.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 2941:
Durin's Day.[1]
T.A. 3018:
Glorfindel hurries Strider and the four hobbits along and they cover a great distance towards the Ford of Bruinen.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
Last quarter[2]

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, John D. Rateliff (ed.), The History of The Hobbit, Return to Bag-End, "The Fifth Phase", "Timelines and Itinerary", "iii. The Timeline Revisited", pp. 826, 828
↑ Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull (eds), The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion, p. xlviii
